Regional, National, International or Fed: The system is voluntary, so national and international by active inclusion

Interoperability with External Systems: {{yes}} (Google Scholar, Scopus, Web of Science, RefWorks, etc.)
Integration with Add-on Components or Pr: {{yes}} (EndNote, Mendeley, Zotero, tools which generate BiBTeX, CSV or XML files)

Research Networking Tool: PROFILES by Mentis® (formerly Collaborative Partnership / Profile System)
Interoperability with External Systems: {{yes}} (has API, works with Elsevier PURE, Activity Insight, VIVO etc.)

Interoperability with Institutional Ente: {{yes}} (Bisynchronous and one way operations with institution's enterprise system both possible.)
Interoperability with External Systems: {{yes}} (Yes, Web of Science, ORCID, pubmed, europubmed.)
Integration with Add-on Components or Pr: {{yes}} (Integrates with Pentaho Research Analytics module and InCites)

Interoperability with Institutional Ente: {{yes}} institutions have access to Web Services in order to feed data into internal databases
Interoperability with External Systems: Web Services can be consumed as directed by institution. Pure currently ingests a range of data from institutions' own systems, including grants data, HR data, institutional repositories, publication databases, book listings and more.
Integration with Add-on Components or Pr: {{yes}} Scopus, PubMed, NIH RePORTER, Embase, Mendeley, arXiv, Worldcat, CrossRef, JournalTOC, CAB Abstracts, SAO/NSA Astrophysics Data System, Web of Science, institution's internal databases, including HR data, grants, publications, patents, etc.
Regional, National, International or Fed: {{yes}} Pure integrates with SciVal to allow easy analysis of your researcher impact with the benchmark capabilities of SciVal.
column6: {{yes}} The Pure Community Module interconnects participating institutions into a single centralized Pure instance. Additional functionality enables users to search across different institutions or run cross-campus reports [1]

Interoperability with Institutional Ente: {{yes}} (Institutions have access to the API with Scopus data in order to feed data into internal databases.)

Interoperability with External Systems: {{yes}} ID resolver included, so links to external systems are created, like SSRN, ResearcherID, Google scholar alerts & Search, social mention search from personal page, MEEBO sharing possible, Tynt statistics included

Interoperability with Institutional Ente: Discontinued. Work on this system ceased
Interoperability with External Systems: moved on to developing Digital Vita

{{yes}} Only other InfoEd modules (SMARTS: Service that automatically sends notices of funding opportunities via email. You provide keywords that describe your research interests, and SMARTS matches those keywords with present funding programs
Integration with Add-on Components or Pr: SPIN: Enables subscribers to directly search for all sponsored programs, past and present, contained within the InfoEd database)
data is semantic web compliant as of August 2011

Research Networking Tool: INDURE (Indiana Database for University Research Expertise)

Interoperability with Institutional Ente: {{yes}} InfoEd, eIRB, Medical School faculty database

Interoperability with External Systems: {{yes}} (PubMed, VIVO, Google Scholar, BibTex or CSV Sources)
{{yes}} Only Clarivate Analytics Web of Science
{{yes}} Pubmed, commercial sources of publication data, semantic web applications via VIVO ontology.
Regional, National, International or Fed: {{yes}} Profiles Users Group has regular conference calls and works on collaborative software development projects. Profiles can perform federated queries across other Profiles instances, and with other products using linked open data (VIVO ontology) and the DIRECT2Experts API.

Research Networking Tool: REACH NC Life Science Experts Visualization Tool

Interoperability with External Systems: {{yes}} Through ResearcherID download service, institutions can load data into their internal systems. Also is integrated with other Clarivate Analytics offerings, including Web of Science, EndNote, and Research In View

Interoperability with Institutional Ente: {{yes}} (is possible through open data exchange standards)

{{yes}} Clients have the ability to integrate with existing web profile management systems, export data for business intelligence solutions and easily submit research outcomes for various government assessment exercises. This includes HR, publications, teaching activities, grants, institutional repositories, and any other system providing or consuming research data.
Interoperability with External Systems: {{yes}} Elements integrates with a variety of external systems including: Altmetric, figshare, ORCID, SHERPA/RoMEO (licensing information), DOAJ (licensing information)
Integration with Add-on Components or Pr: {{yes}} Elements can be linked to all major open repository technologies and an open source VIVO Harvester extension is also available.

Interoperability with Institutional Ente: {{yes}} Data can be ingested from a wide variety of local sources (including HR, grants, course databases, institutional repositories, membership rosters, research interests, and many others) to reflect a complete view of the institution's priorities and efforts.
column6: many others - any tool that can consume open linked data. Other ongoing collaborations with Wellspring (maintaining VIVO profiles with a focus upon tech transfer and also as a 3rd party implementation service provider) and with Symplectic.
column7: {{yes}} VIVO collaborates with eagle-I on research resources. Future plans include adding many additional data types which are meaningful in the academic research setting. VIVO data are structured using a comprehensive ontology designed for local extension and major ontology "plugins" such as BIBO and eagle-i.
column8: {{yes}} VIVO Consortium received $12.2M NIH ARRA U24 award in 2009 to fully develop software and create national system of federated research expertise directories/research networking systems
column9: All other semantic web-compliant software platforms can be integrated into the consortium (example: Harvard Profiles). Participant in Direct2Experts and VIVO Search

Regional, National, International or Fed: The Canadian research funding councils as well as knowledge mobilization networks across the country (governments and universities) are working to develop a model to share what Yaffle has built
